text: 5 5 6 A BLAZING SUN 6 TILT DOWN to a blistering summer sky. A TITLE CARD appears:
and
Hey "Big D." Beat up another ten year old?
This one deserved it. 2.
Four against one. Very brave.
Yeah, well you're one to talk. Moaning in your sleep every night. At least I'm not afraid of my pillow.
What are you talking about?
Don't kill Cedric! Don't kill Cedric! Who's Cedric--your boyfriend?
Dad! Help me, Dad!
Shut up. THUNDER CRACKS. The other boys peer uneasily at the sky.
He's going to kill me, Mum!
Shut up Dudley, I'm warning you--!
Wh-what are you doing?
I'm not doing anything.
Oh no.
Lumos!
Accio!
EXPECTO PATRONUM!
Don't put away your wand, boy!
Dementors, in Little Whinging! What's next, Giants trodding the M4? The whole world's gone topsy- turvy...!
I don't understand. How do you know about--?
After You-Know-Who killed that poor Diggory boy last year did you expect him to let you wander around on your own? Good Lord, boy, they told me you were intelligent.
Now: get inside and stay there. I expect someone will be in touch soon, but whatever happens: don't leave the house!
Diddykins? Is that...
DIDDY! VERNON, come quick! VERNON DURSLEY, standing in front of the open freezer eating from a carton of ice cream, looks up vaguely.
We have to take him to Hospital!
Who did this to you, boy? Dudley's shaking finger rises at Harry. Vernon approaches, brandishing the dripping spoon.
Happy are we now?! You've finally
Don't say that, Vernon! 6.

Dear Mr. Potter: The Ministry has received intelligence that at twenty-three minutes past six this evening you performed the Patronus Charm in the presence of a Muggle. As a clear violation of the Decree for the Reasonable Restriction of Underage Sorcery, you are hereby expelled from Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Hoping that you are well, Mafalda Hopkirk.
Justice. In the b.g., Dudley again heaves into the plant. 13 OMITTED 13
Sorry, Hedwig... Harry turns...bends down to find the moving PHOTO of
Cedric--!
Tonks--for God's sake...
Very clean, these Muggles. Bit unnatural...
Oh, this is better...
Rescuing you, of course.
But where are we going? If I've been expelled from Hogwarts--
You haven't been--not yet, anyway. Kingsley, you take point.
But--the letter said--
--pending a formal hearing.
Don't worry, Harry. We'll explain everything when we get back to Headquarters--
Shhh! Not here, Nymphadora.
Don't. Call me. Nymphadora.
Stop being so cheerful, Madeye-- he'll think we're not taking this seriously...
Get a move on, sonny!
--the facade finishes expanding into place with a gentle POP...as the STEREO THUDS on, unperturbed.
Thank heavens you're all right...
No time to explain. Upstairs, first door on the left!
...mudbloods and werewolves and traitors and thieves...if my poor Mistress knew the scum they've let
HARRY--!
Are you all right? We overheard
--and this hearing at the Ministry--it's just outrageous!
Yeah, there's a lot of that going around. What is this place anyway?
It's Headquarters...
...of the Order of the Phoenix. It's a secret society; Dumbledore
Couldn't have put any of this in a letter I suppose. I've gone all summer without any bloody news!
We wanted to write mate, really we did--only--
Only what?
Only Dumbledore made us swear not to tell you anything.
Harry. 13.
Thought we heard your dulcet tones.
Don't bottle up your anger, Harry; let it out!
Anyway if you're all done shouting--
--want to hear something really interesting...?
Snape's part of the Order? 14.
Well! We'll be eating down in the kitchen-- Without warning Fred and George APPARATE--CRACK!--on
JUST BECAUSE YOU'RE ALLOWED TO USE MAGIC NOW DOESN'T MEAN YOU HAVE TO WHIP YOUR WANDS OUT FOR EVERYTHING!
You're sure you're all right, Harry? Gave us all quite a turn.
Sirius.
...this is most unusual...it seems Minister Fudge has called your hearing before the entire Wizengamot...
It's a set-up. A chance to publicly discredit Harry.
I'm afraid you may be right, Padfoot...
I don't understand. What does the Ministry of Magic have against me? Silence. Tonks and Ginny frown; Ron and Hermione exchange an apprehensive look. Sirius hesitates...
But...why?
Exactly the point. Fudge isn't in
So what's Voldemort been up to-- seeing as everyone's so
We think he wants to build up his
We think Voldemort may be after
You mean...like a weapon?
THAT'S ENOUGH!
Good--I want to join. If Voldemort's building an army I want to fight.
I know, Harry. But for all you've been through, you're not an adult-- not yet.
Trains under the ground! So ingenious, these Muggles...
Well! Here we are. He gestures "after you" to the bewildered Harry, then
I've never used the visitor's entrance before. This should be fun! 18.
Sorry...let's see... M...A...G... I...C. For a moment nothing happens--and then the telephone box SHUDDERS, and with a dull GRINDING begins sinking into
'Morning Arthur.
'Morning Bob.
Interdepartmental memos. We used to use owls, but the mess was unbelievable. 19. Just before the gates close Shacklebolt hurries in. As
Merlin's Beard. Thank you Kingsley.
When is it?
Five minutes ago. As Wizards automatically reach for hanging straps above
Department of Mysteries. Mr. Weasley pulls Harry out of the lift--and turns down
...now remember, during the hearing you must speak only when spoken too, and stay calm--you've done nothing wrong. As the Muggles say,
Not allowed in, I'm afraid. Good luck, Harry.
Disciplinary hearing of the twelfth of August into offenses committed by Harry James Potter, resident at number four, Privet Drive, Little Whinging, Surrey.
Interrogators: Cornelius Oswald Fudge, Minister of Magic; Amelia Susan Bones, Department of Magical Law Enforcement; Dolores Jane Umbridge, Senior Undersecretary to
--Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore.
Er. You got our message that the time and place of the hearing had been changed, did you?
I must have missed it. But due to
No, but--
Do you deny it was in the presence of a Muggle, one Dursley Dudley?
No, but--
--and you were aware you are forbidden to use magic outside school while under the age of seventeen?
Yes, but--
I only did it because of the Dementors!
Dementors? In Little Whinging?
Clever. Muggles can't see Dementors. Highly convenient.
I'm not lying! There were two of them, and if I hadn't--
Enough! I'm sorry to interrupt what I'm sure would have been a very well-rehearsed story, but as you can produce no witnesses-- 22.
Pardon me, Minister, but as it happens...we can. ANGLE - MOMENTS LATER
Please describe the attack. What
Well...one was very large, and the other rather skinny--
Not the boys, the Dementors.
Oh. Right... Big...cloaked...
Now look here! Dementors don't just wander into a Muggle suburb and happen across a wizard. The odds are astronomical--!
Oh, I don't think any of us believe
I'm sure I must have misunderstood you, Professor. Dementors are, after all, under the control of
That would be disturbing indeed, Madame Undersecretary...which is why I'm confident the Ministry will be making a full inquiry into why two Dementors were so very far
Cornelius...I implore you to listen to reason. The evidence that the Dark Lord has returned is incontravert--
HE'S. NOT. BACK! Silence! Fudge is quivering with rage; even Percy is taken aback. Dumbledore sighs deeply...then quietly addresses the Panel.
In the matter of Harry Potter: the law plainly states that magic may be used before Muggles in life- threatening situations.
Laws can be changed, Dumbledore.
Clearly--if it has become practice to hold a full criminal trial to deal with a simple matter of underage magic.
Those in favor of clearing the witness of all charges? 24.
Those in favor of conviction?
Cleared of all charges. As the assembled adjourn Harry turns gratefully to Dumbledore--but the Headmaster is already sweeping away,
Are you barking mad? You'll blow
Sirius! What are you doing here?! If somebody sees you--
I just don't want to see you chucked back in Azkaban! 25.
Being trapped in that house day and night is almost as bad. Worst part about being a fugitive is how bloody boring it is...
Original Order of the Phoenix.
You all look so young.
We were.
Neville's parents...
It's been fourteen years...and still a day doesn't go by I don't miss your dad.
I wish I could have known him...
Sirius...Do you really think there's going to be a war? 26.
It feels like it did before. Like
You keep it. Anyway, I suppose you're the young ones now...
I'm surprised the Ministry's still letting you walk around free, Potter. Better enjoy it while you can--I expect there's a cell in Azkaban with your name on it...
It's only Malfoy, Harry. What'd you expect...?
Just--stay away from me...
What'd I tell you--complete nutter. MOMENTS LATER. As the trio approach the rain-washed road we see a CARRIAGE; inside is CHO CHANG and several
What is it?
What's what?
That. Pulling the carriage.
Nothing's pulling the carriage, Harry. It's pulling itself--like always.
You're Harry Potter.
I don't know who you are.
Oh, nobody, really.
What an interesting necklace.
Oh thank you! It's a charm actually.
Hungry. I hope there's pudding. As the carriage RATTLES off... 42 OMITTED 42
...We have two changes in staffing this year. We are pleased to welcome back Professor Grubbly- Plank, who will be taking Care of Magical Creatures while Professor

...We also wish to welcome our new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher--Professor Dolores Umbridge. REVEAL Umbridge--in pink Alice band and matching cardigan--sitting beside Trelawney. Harry is stunned. DUMBLEDORE (O.S.) [I'm sure I'm not alone in saying good luck, Professor...]
You know her?
She was at my hearing. She works for Fudge.
...As usual, our Caretaker Mr. Filch has asked me to remind you--
Hem, hem. 30. Umbridge rises, steps toward the podium. Momentarily taken aback, Dumbledore politely yields the floor, to a MURMUR of shocked surprise from both teachers and students.
Thank you Headmaster, for those kind words of welcome. And how lovely to see all your bright happy faces smiling up at me...
...progress for progress's sake must be discouraged. A balance then, between old and new, between permanence and change, between tradition and innovation. We think she's done--the students EXHALE--
--Let us preserve what must be preserved, perfect what can be perfected--and prune practices that ought to be prohibited.

Thank you Professor Umbridge; that was most...illuminating. As I was saying, Mr. Filch has asked me... 31. DUMBLEDORE (O.S.) [...to remind you all that magic is not permitted in corridors between classes, nor are any number of other things, all of which can be checked on the extensive list now fastened to Mr. Filch's office door. First-years ought to know that the Forest in
Illuminating? What a load of waffle!
There was important stuff hidden in that waffle.
What's it mean?
It means the Ministry's interfering at Hogwarts.
Dean. Seamus. Good holiday?
All right. Better than Seamus's anyway.
Me Mam didn't want me to come back. 32.
Why not?
Well...I suppose because of you.
Nobody knows what really happened
Then I guess you should read the Prophet like your stupid mother-- it'll tell you everything you need to know!
Don't you have a go at my mother!
I'll have a go at anyone who calls me a liar--!
He's mad is what's going on! Do you believe the rubbish he's come out with about You-Know-Who?
As a matter of fact, I do! So unless you want a fistful of Weasley you'll shut your mouth!
You all right?
I said I'm fine, Ron!
Right. I'll just leave you to your thoughts, then.
Good morning, children!
Ordinary. Wizarding. Level. Examinations...
Your previous instruction in this subject has been disturbingly... uneven. But you will be pleased to know that from now on you will be
There's nothing in here about actually using defensive spells.
But surely the whole point of Defense Against the Dark Arts--
Wizards much older and cleverer than yourself have devised our new program of study. You will be learning about defensive spells in
What use is that? If we're going to be attacked it won't be "risk free--" 35.
And how's theory's supposed to prepare us for what's out there?
There is nothing out there, dear. Who do you imagine wants to attack children like yourself?
Oh, I don't know. Maybe Lord Voldemort?
Let me make this quite plain. You have been told that a certain Dark wizard is at large once again. This is a lie.
It's not a lie. I saw him, I
Detention, Mr. Potter!
So according to you, Cedric Diggory
Cedric Diggory's death was a tragic accident.
It was murder. Voldemort killed him and you know it--!
Enough.
Ripples past. It's strangely familiar--
Jaw clenched, eyes rapidly moving in REM-sleep--ZZZZP--

Still closer...as we PAN to reveal HARRY making his way down a dark, torchlit corridor--we were looking at his REFLECTION, the distorted, broken effect caused by the ridges between the wall's shiny black tiles. As we PAN BACK to Harry's reflection it again crosses
--a most important means of divination. For the inner eye sees sights to which the outer world is blind... 37.
Oh! What are you doing here?
Oh don't mind me, dear...
Nothing whatsoever to worry about of course. Please, do go on. I'm just a fly on the wall...
Yes. Well--
Just one question dear. You've been in this post how long exactly?
Nearly sixteen years.
Quite a period...And it was
Just one more thing. If it isn't too much bother, would you please... predict something for me? 38.
Sorry?
Predict something. Surely you're not surprised I ask. You would have foreseen it--no?
The--the Inner Eye does not See upon command!
Come now, one teensy little prophecy...No? Pity.
I...I think I do see something... something dark...
Yes.
But you were unsuccessful...?
Obviously.
Do you have any idea why Dumbledore has consistently refused to appoint you?
I suggest you ask him.
Come in.
Good evening, Mr. Potter. You know why you are here?
Pink. Er...yes.
And telling the truth.
You are going to be doing some lines for me today, Mr. Potter.
Now: I want you to write 'I must not tell lies.'
How many times?
Oh, let's say for as long as it takes for the message to sink in.
You haven't given me any ink.
Oh, you won't need ink.
Yes?
That's right. Because deep down, you know you deserve to be punished. Don't you, Mr. Potter...
...oh, now he's feeling it!
Sweets to make you ill!
Get out of class whenever you like!
Extract hours of leisure from unprofitable boredom!
Care for another? As Nigel races off to vomit George and Fred high-five. FIND Ron and Hermione entering, mid-conversation.
...I'm not asking you to write all of it for me, just...most of it.
All right; I'll do the introduction--but that's all. 42.
I'll know you're back to normal.
What's wrong with your hand?
You've got to tell Dumbledore.
Bloody hell Harry, the woman's torturing you! If the parents knew about this--!
Well I haven't got any of those, have I Ron!
Harry...You've got to report this. It's a simple matter of--
No it's not!
Hermione...Whatever's going on here...it isn't simple. 43.
You don't understand.
Then help us to.
Hello, Harry Potter.
They're called Thestrals. They're quite gentle, really, but most
Different.
My Mum. She was quite an
I'm sorry.
Um...Thanks. Seems you're about
Oh, I don't think that's true... Luna reaches into a bag and produces a piece of RAW MEAT; gently tosses it toward the BABY THESTRAL, who happily catches it in mid-air.
...But I suppose that's how he wants you to feel.
What do you mean?
Well if I were You-Know-Who...I'd want you to be cut off from everyone else. Because if it's just you alone... you're not as much of a threat.
Don't you ever stop eating?
Wha'? Ah'm 'ungry...
Harry.
All right if I join you?
...I am merely requesting that when it comes to my students, you conform to prescribed disciplinary practices...
So silly of me, but it sounds as though you're questioning my authority in my own classroom...
Not at all...
I am sorry dear...but to question my practices is to question the Ministry--and, by extension, the Minister himself. I am a tolerant woman, but the one thing I can't stand for is disloyalty.
Disloyalty--?
Things at Hogwarts are far worse than I feared. Cornelius will want to take immediate action...
--Having already revolutionised
As a parent, I believe the Ministry is doing what's best for all our sakes...
Cho--what's going on?
It's Professor Trelawney. 50. 54 OMITTED 54 54A OMITTED 54A & & 54B 54B 55 OMITTED 55 55A OMITTED 55A & & 55B 55B 56 OMITTED 56 56A OMITTED 56A & & 56B 56B 57 OMITTED 57 57A OMITTED 57A

Actually...
Something you'd like to say, dear?
Oh, there are several things I'd like to say.
Dumbledore: May I remind you that under the terms of Educational Decree Number Twenty-three, as enacted by the Minister--!
--you have the right to dismiss my teachers. You do not, however,
I trust you all have studying to do?
Professor? Professor--!
That foul, evil old gargoyle! We've got to do something! 52.
THAT'S NOT THE POINT, RON! We're not learning how to defend ourselves, we're not learning what we need to pass our OWLS, she's taking over the entire school-- what's Dumbledore playing at?

At the witching hour, here are the latest headlines...Cornelius Fudge today denied rumors that the mysterious disappearance of several Ministry workers is related to last year's appearance of the Dark Mark at the Quidditch World Cup...
...With increased incidents of Goblin unrest as well as rumblings among the Giants, the Minister sought to quell the qualms of the wizard world:
Sirius! What are you doing here? 53.
Answering your letter. You said you were worried about Umbridge. What's she doing, training you all to kill half breeds?
Half-breeds? What are you talking about?
Sirius, she's not letting us use magic at all.
I might have guessed. Latest intelligence is Fudge doesn't want you trained in combat.
What can we do, Sirius?
I'm not sure...I do know your Dad never would have lain down for the likes of Umbridge.
We've got to be able to defend ourselves. And if Umbridge refuses to teach us how...
This is mad. Who'd want to be taught by me? I'm a nutter, remember?
Look on the bright side--you can't be any worse than old toad-face. 55.
I'm here for you, mate.
Lovely spot.
I thought it'd be safer someplace off the beaten track.
Who's supposed to be meeting us?
Oh, just a couple of people...
Um--hi. So, you all know why we're here. We need a teacher--a proper teacher, one who's had real experience defending themselves against the Dark Arts--
Why? 56.
Why? Because You-Know-Who is back, you tosspot!
So Dumbledore says--
If Potter could tell us more about how Diggory got killed...
I'm not going to talk about Cedric. So if that's what you're here for, you might as well clear out now.
Let's go. They're just here because
Yes. I've seen it. A fully-formed stag Patronus.
Blimey Harry! I never knew that!
It's true.
Wait.
Look--it all sounds great when you say it like that. But the truth is,
No, Hermione. I'm not.
You just...you don't know what it's like.
You're right Harry. We don't. That's why we need your help. Because if we're to have any chance of beating V-Voldemort...
We're the young ones now.
Too small.
Not bloody likely.
Harry...What happens if Umbridge does find out?
Who are you, and what have you done with Hermione Granger? 59.
What's that?
Okay: in the next few days each of us comes up with a couple of possibilities for places to practice... As the others nod we MOVE IN ON Neville, his brow creased in concentration...
Watch where you're going, Longbottom...
You've done it, Neville! You've found the Room of Requirement!
I've heard rumors about it for ages but I never believed them until now...!
So, say you really needed a toilet...?
Charming, Ronald. But yes, that's
It's brilliant. Like Hogwarts wants us to fight back... Suddenly a glint of silver falls past Harry's face. Harry
All right...so...I was thinking
Isn't that sort of...basic?
It saved my life last year. An impressed MURMUR. Ron and Hermione exchange a happy look...Harry exhales--he's begun.

towers above us, its hideous skull-like MASK grinning. PULL BACK to reveal it is a quite realistic-looking DUMMY, its arms extended, one hand holding a prodigious bone WAND. Uneasy STUDENTS stand in a line before it--Neville first.
Expelliarmus!
I'm hopeless.
No you're not. You're just flourishing your wand too much. Here, try it like this--
--to ensure maximum retention.
No need to think's more like it.
Wands away!
....it's sort of a wizard's bread and butter, really... Students LAUGH appreciatively; as Harry turns we see who he's squared off against--a very nervous Nigel. Harry smiles encouragingly:
It's all right, Nigel. Take your best shot.
STUPEFY!
Not bad. Next--
Don't worry--I'll go easy on you.
I--I let her do that. I mean it's just good manners, isn't it!
Little higher there...nice.
...every great wizard in history started out as nothing more than what we are now--students. If they could do it...why not you? Harry turns to survey the room--STUDENTS FLOATING in the

I--I did it.

Sounds good guys...would you excuse me?

I'm okay. Anyway it's worth it...
It's just...learning all this...it makes me wonder whether if he'd known it...
You're a really good teacher, Harry. I've never been able to Stun anything before... Cho looks into Harry's eyes. The moment is palpable...and as Cho silently glances up, we SWEEP UP TO REVEAL the
Mistletoe.
What are Nargles?
No idea.
Well? How was it?
Wet.
I'm sure Harry's kissing was more than satisfactory. Cho spends half
You'd think a bit of snogging
Well obviously she's feeling sad about Cedric, and therefore confused about liking Harry and
One person can't feel all that at once, they'd explode!
Just because you've got the emotional range of a teaspoon...
...in the dream, were you standing beside the victim, or looking down
Neither. It was like I...I...
Professor...please...just tell me--
Everard.
Phineas: I need you to go to your portrait at Grimmauld Place. Tell
What's happening to me...?
You wished to see me, Headmaster?
Yes, Severus. I'm afraid we daren't wait even until morning.
It would appear there is a connection between the Dark Lord's
You mean if he knows...he'll be able to read my mind?
Read it. Control it. Unhinge it... In the past it was often the Dark Lord's pleasure to invade the
88 88 88A OMITTED 88A
Of course, Master. Kreacher lives to serve the Noble House of Black...
Wait a second--you grew up here? 76.
It was my parents house. I offered it to Dumbledore as headquarters for the Order. About the only useful thing I've been able to do.
I hated the lot of them; my parents
My Mother did that after I ran away. Charming woman. I was sixteen.
Where did you go?
Your Dad's. I was always welcome at the Potter's... I see him so much in you, Harry. You're so very much alike...
I'm not so sure.
This connection between me and Voldemort--what if the reason for it is because...is because I'm
I want you to listen to me very carefully, Harry. You are not a bad person. You're a very good person, who bad things have happened to. Do you understand?
Harry? Time to go.
Seems like we're always saying goodbye.

It won't always be this way. When all this is over we'll be a proper family. You'll see. As Sirius and Harry hug, we MOVE PAST them toward the tapestry. We PUSH IN on the SCORCHED HOLE above Sirius' name--FLY THROUGH IT-- 89A OMITTED 89A
...I will say this one last time. As High Inquisitor and the Ministry's representative I am ordering you to tell me where you've been!
I told yer--I've been away for me health.
Your health.
Bit o' fresh air, yeh know.
Yes, as gamekeeper fresh air must be difficult to come by.
I don't see what that has to do
No...You wouldn't.
Oh Hagrid, what happened?
I told yer, it's nothin'. Want a cuppa?
Nothing? Would you say that if one of us turned up with a pound of mince instead of a face?
Hagrid...it's us.
Now this is all top secret, mind yeh...but Dumbledore sent me ter parley with the Giants.
Giants!
They're not that difficult ter find, ter be honest. Pretty big, see. Live deep in the mountains... Went over a ridge one nigh' an'
And they did this to you?
Anyhow I tried to convince 'em ter join the cause--but I wasn't the only one trying to win 'em over... 80.
Death Eaters?

Don' know. I gave 'em Dumbledore's message; I 'spect some o' them'll remember he's friendly to 'em...I 'spect. Oh all right yeh can have it, yeh dozy dog... Fang, who has been WHIMPERING plaintively, now leaps up
It's changin' out there. Jus' like last time...
95D 95D 96 OMITTED 96 96A OMITTED 96A
My Lord.
We strongly suspect this breakout was engineered by a man with personal experience escaping Azkaban: notorious mass-murderer
I wanted to apologize. Now even me Mam says the Prophet's version of things don't add up. What I'm trying to say is...I believe you.
Fourteen years ago...a Death Eater named Bellatrix Lestrange used the Cruciatus Curse on my parents. She
Make it a powerful memory, the happiest you can remember. Allow it to fill you up...
Keep trying, Seamus...
Now remember: Your Patronus can only protect you as long as you stay focused...
Focus, Luna.
Think of the happiest thing you can, Neville.
Harry!
Who've we got this time?
All of them I think. INSERT: On the MARAUDER'S MAP we see the names UMBRIDGE, FILCH, MALFOY--and a DOZEN OTHERS--floating just on the other side of the wall. Harry frowns.
Stand aside, Argus. I'll make short work of this. She AIMS HER WAND directly at us. Harry's eyes go wide--
GET DOWN!
BOMBARDA MAXIMA!
RUN!
All your fearmongering about You- Know-Who never fooled us for a minute. We saw your lies for what they were--a smokescreen for your bid to seize control of the Ministry!
Naturally.
Professor--no--!
Dispatch an owl to the Daily Prophet; if we hurry we should still make the morning edition. Dawlish, Shacklebolt: You will escort Dumbledore to Azkaban to await trial for conspiracy and sedition--
Ah, I thought we might hit that little snag. You seem to be laboring under the delusion that I am going to--what is the phrase? 'Come quietly.' But I'm afraid I have no intention of going to Azkaban.
You may not like him, Minister... but you can't deny Dumbledore's got style.
We CORKSCREW down and through the Marble Stair. Most of
Harry...
...you did everything you could. No one could win against that old hag.
He's right. Not even Dumbledore saw this coming. Besides, if it's anyone's fault it's ours...
Yeah, we talked you into it. 88.
But I agreed.
...because I don't want to play anymore. All it does is make you care too much. And the more you care...the more you have to lose.
What?
Go it alone.
Hagrid...? 105A OMITTED 105A & & 105B 105B
Any idea where he's taking us?
Hagrid? Please, can't you just tell us--
What is that?
Whatever it is...it's not a happy sound.
Never seen the Centaurs so riled-- an' they're dangerous at the bes'
Sorry t'be so mysterious you three. I wouldn' be botherin' yer with this at all--but with Dumbledore gone I'll likely be gettin' the sack any day now, an' I can' leave
About...who?
Harry...that hill. It's breathing. As the "hill" shifts in its sleep several BIRDS light into the air. Hagrid cautiously approaches the slumbering
Oh Hagrid...you didn't.
I had ter bring 'im back! The other giants were all bullyin' him, 'cause he's so small!
Small?
I couldn' jus' leave 'im! See-- he's my brother.
Blimey.
Well--half-brother. Turns out
Had a nice sleep, did yeh Grawpy?
